terms:
Effective date: [05.10.2025]

Operator: Time2Show, Inc., 1111B S Governors Ave STE 20579, Dover, DE 19904, USA

Website: https://idol-brands.netlify.app


Contact: hello@idolbrands.com


1. Definitions

1.1. Operator / We / Us / Our â€“ Time2Show, Inc., 1111B S Governors Ave STE 20579, Dover, DE 19904, United States.

1.2. Website / Platform â€“ the online service available at https://idol-brands.netlify.app

, operated by the Operator.

1.3. User / You / Client / Influencer â€“ any individual or entity that accesses or uses the Website or services.

1.4. Services â€“ all digital and business services offered by the Operator, including but not limited to brand creation, e-commerce integration, logistics, production, marketing, and consulting.

1.5. Agreement â€“ any contract concluded between the Operator and the User, including these Terms.

1.6. Content â€“ all materials, text, graphics, logos, videos, and data published on or provided through the Platform.

2. Acceptance of Terms

2.1. By accessing or using our Website or Services, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms & Conditions.

2.2. If you do not agree, you may not use our Services.

2.3. We may modify these Terms at any time. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated version.

3. Accounts and Access

3.1. To use certain Services, you may need to create an account.

3.2. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your credentials and for all activities that occur under your account.

3.3. The Operator may suspend or terminate accounts that violate these Terms or applicable laws.

4. Services and Performance

4.1. Idol Brands connects creators, influencers, and brands, offering digital and production services to build and scale fashion and lifestyle brands.

4.2. Specific terms (pricing, timelines, deliverables) will be defined individually in written agreements.

4.3. While we use reasonable skill and care, we cannot guarantee error-free or uninterrupted operation of third-party services or suppliers.

4.4. Users must provide necessary materials (logos, photos, approvals, etc.) in a timely manner.

5. Payments

5.1. Users must pay all fees as agreed in the contract or pricing plan.

5.2. Payments are due in full and on time; delays may incur interest or service suspension.

5.3. Prices are exclusive of taxes unless otherwise stated. Users are responsible for any applicable VAT or other taxes under local law.

5.4. All payments are non-refundable unless otherwise agreed or required by law.

6. Intellectual Property

6.1. All content, code, visuals, and branding created by or for Idol Brands remain the property of Time2Show, Inc. or its licensors, unless explicitly transferred by written agreement.

6.2. You retain rights to your own pre-existing materials but grant us a limited license to use them for service delivery.

6.3. You warrant that all materials you provide do not infringe third-party rights.

7. Limitation of Liability

7.1. To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages (e.g., loss of profit, data, or goodwill).

7.2. Our total liability under any claim shall not exceed the total amount paid by you in the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to liability.

7.3. Nothing in these Terms limits liability for fraud, gross negligence, or mandatory consumer rights.

8. Privacy and Data Protection

8.1. We process personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and U.S. privacy laws (including the Delaware Online Privacy and Protection Act).

8.2. Detailed rules are provided in our Privacy Policy, available on the Website.

8.3. You agree that we may store and process your data for the purpose of providing and improving our services.

9. Termination

9.1. Either party may terminate cooperation with notice as defined in the individual agreement.

9.2. Upon termination, you remain liable for all outstanding payments and obligations.

9.3. We may terminate access immediately in case of breach or illegal use.

10. Prohibited Activities

10.1. Users may not use the Platform to engage in unlawful, harmful, defamatory, or fraudulent activities.

10.2. Unauthorized access attempts, spamming, or interference with system security are strictly prohibited.

11. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution

11.1. These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, USA, and, for EU users, also in compliance with EU consumer and data protection law.

11.2. Any disputes shall be resolved by the competent court in Delaware, unless otherwise required by mandatory local law for EU consumers.
